      Same as the getValue(int,int) method but no shift takes place.
      static int getValue(int value, int mask)
      Returns the value of a number accoring to the bit mask given. for instance: 01010100 - original number 00110000 - mask -------- 4 - because the method only considers the 'masked' bits and then shifts them right till they are the least significant bits.
      static int getValue(int value, int mask, int shift)
      Same as the getValue(int,int) method but allows an arbitrary shift to take place.
      static int getValue(java.lang.String bits) 
      static boolean isSet(int value, int mask)
      Checks a number to see if a particular bit (or any bit of a mask) is set.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BitFieldUtil

        public BitFieldUtil()

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public static int getValue(int value,
           int mask)
        Returns the value of a number accoring to the bit mask given. for instance: 01010100 - original number 00110000 - mask -------- 4 - because the method only considers the 'masked' bits and then shifts them right till they are the least significant bits. see the javadoc for the getShiftCount for a fuller understanding of how why or how this is done.
        Parameters:
        value - the bitfield containing a number to be 'extracted'
        mask - the bit mask to identify the relevant bits.
        Returns:
        the value of the bits 'extracted'

      • getValue

        public static int getValue(int value,
           int mask,
           int shift)
        Same as the getValue(int,int) method but allows an arbitrary shift to take place.
        Parameters:
        value - the bitfield containing a number to be 'extracted'
        mask - the bit mask to identify the relevant bits.
        shift - the number of bits to shift
        Returns:
        the value of the bits 'extracted'

      • getRawValue

        public static int getRawValue(int value,
              int mask)
        Same as the getValue(int,int) method but no shift takes place.
        Parameters:
        value - the bitfield containing a number to be 'extracted'
        mask - the bit mask to identify the relevant bits.
        Returns:
        the value of the bits 'extracted' in their original positions (and thus binary values)

      • isSet

        public static boolean isSet(int value,
            int mask)
        Checks a number to see if a particular bit (or any bit of a mask) is set.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to be checked
        mask - the mask to check against
        Returns:
        true if a value has one or more of the bits in the mask set.

      • getBytes

        public static byte[] getBytes(int number)

            int endbit)

        public static int getValue(java.lang.String bits)
